Detecting punctuation

A period detects any character. To represent an actual period, brackets [.] or an escape (backslash) followed by a period and a forward slash may work. 

Examples:
```{r}

abbreviations <- "Mrs. Doubtfire popped the lid. Dr. Stewart came back !"
a <- unlist(strsplit(abbreviations, split = "(?<=[.][A-Z]", fixed = FALSE, perl = TRUE, useBytes = TRUE))
a

a <- "said Michael? The teacher"
a <- unlist(strsplit(a, split = "?.*[A-Za-z]", fixed = FALSE, perl = TRUE, useBytes = TRUE))
a #X

a <- "said Michael. The teacher...What do you Want ?....I said what do you want ! I run."
a <- unlist(strsplit(a, split = "n[.]", fixed = FALSE, perl = TRUE, useBytes = TRUE))
a #X

a <- "said Michael? The teacher"
a <- unlist(strsplit(a, split = "\\B[?][A-Za-z]\\B", fixed = FALSE, perl = TRUE, useBytes = TRUE))
a #X
```
